SEARCH
Package com.karandev.util.net

Class UdpUtil

java.lang.Object
com.karandev.util.net.UdpUtil
public final class UdpUtil extends Object
Utility class with usage of datagram packets and datagram sockets for UDP operations, includes sending and receiving primitive type values and texts.

Copyleft (c) 1993 by C and System Programmers Association (CSD) All Rights Free

Author:
JavaApp2-Jan-2024 Group
See Also:
  • DatagramPacket
  • DatagramSocket

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static boolean
    receiveBoolean(int port)
    Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single boolean value, regardless of the bit sequence, through from a new DatagramSocket object that bind to localhost
    static boolean

    Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single boolean value, regardless of the bit sequence, through from the given datagramSocket object

  • Method Details

    • sendByte

      public static void sendByte(String host, int port, byte val)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object which is bind to the given ip address host and port number then sends a single byte value, regardless of the bit sequence, through of a new DatagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      host - the ip address of the transfer destination
      port - the port number of transfer destination
      val - the byte value which will be sent
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while constructing the objects or sending data through the socket

    • sendByte

      public static void sendByte(DatagramSocket datagramSocket, String host, int port, byte val)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object which is bind to the given ip address host and port number then sends a single byte value, regardless of the bit sequence, through of given datagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the socket which will be used for transfer data
      host - the ip address of the transfer destination
      port - the port number of transfer destination
      val - the byte value which will be sent
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while sending data through the socket or creating the datagram packet

      str - the String object which will be sent

    • receiveByte

      public static byte receiveByte(DatagramSocket datagramSocket)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single byte value, regardless of the bit sequence, through from the given datagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the socket which will be used for receiving data
      Returns:
      the received byte value
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is not equals to length of the type Byte

    • receiveByte

      public static byte receiveByte(int port)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single byte value, regardless of the bit sequence, through from a new DatagramSocket object that bind to localhost
      Parameters:
      port - the port number of DatagramSocket object that will be used for communication
      Returns:
      the received byte value
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is not equals to length of the type Byte

    • receiveFloat

      public static float receiveFloat(int port)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single float value, regardless of the bit sequence, through from a new DatagramSocket object that bind to localhost
      Parameters:
      port - the port number of DatagramSocket object that will be used for communication
      Returns:
      the received float value
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is not equals to length of the type Float

    • receiveDouble

      public static double receiveDouble(DatagramSocket datagramSocket)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single double value, regardless of the bit sequence, through from the given datagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the socket which will be used for receiving data
      Returns:
      the received double value
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is not equals to length of the type Double

    • receiveString

      public static String receiveString(DatagramSocket datagramSocket, int maxLength)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single String object in default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8, regardless of the bit sequence, through from the given datagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the socket which will be used for receiving data
      maxLength - the max length of the string object which will be received in a datagram packet on a single fetch
      Returns:
      the received String object
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is greater than maxLength

    • receiveString

      public static String receiveString(int port, int maxLength)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single String object in default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8, regardless of the bit sequence, through from a new DatagramSocket object that bind to localhost

      the received String object

    • receiveString

      public static String receiveString(DatagramSocket datagramSocket, int maxLength, Charset charset)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to receive a single String object in given charset, regardless of the bit sequence, through from the given datagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the socket which will be used for receiving data
      maxLength - the max length of the string object which will be received in a datagram packet on a single fetch
      charset - the specified charset of the String value to be received
      Returns:
      the received String object
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is greater than maxLength

    • receiveString

    • receiveDatagramPacket

      public static DatagramPacket receiveDatagramPacket(DatagramSocket datagramSocket, int maxLength)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to fill it in default charset StandardCharsets.UTF_8, regardless of the bit sequence, through from the given datagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the socket which will be used for receiving data
      maxLength - the max length of the received data that fills the datagram packet on a single fetch
      Returns:
      the received DatagramPacket object
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is greater than maxLength

    • receiveDatagramPacket

      public static DatagramPacket receiveDatagramPacket(int port, int maxLength)

      Parameters:
      port - the port number of DatagramSocket object that will be used for communication
      maxLength - the max length of the received data that fills the datagram packet on a single fetch

      the received DatagramPacket object
      Throws:

    • receiveDatagramPacket

      public static DatagramPacket receiveDatagramPacket(DatagramSocket datagramSocket, int maxLength, Charset charset)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to fill it, in given charset, regardless of the bit sequence, through from the given datagramSocket object
      Parameters:
      datagramSocket - the socket which will be used for receiving data
      maxLength - the max size of data which will be received in a datagram packet on a single fetch
      charset - the specified charset of the Datagram Packet object to be received
      Returns:
      the received DatagramPacket object
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is greater than maxLength

    • receiveDatagramPacket

      public static DatagramPacket receiveDatagramPacket(int port, int maxLength, Charset charset)
      Creates a new DatagramPacket object that uses a byte array for fetching the data, then waits for to fill it, in given charset, regardless of the bit sequence, through from a new DatagramSocket object that bind to localhost
      Parameters:
      port - the port number of DatagramSocket object that will be used for communication
      maxLength - the max length of the string object which will be received in a datagram packet on a single fetch
      charset - the specified charset of the String value to be received
      Returns:
      the received DatagramPacket object
      Throws:
      NetworkException - if any problem occurs while creating the datagram packet, receiving data through from the socket or received packet length is greater than maxLength
